title: Inter Milan 1-2 Juventus: Gonzalo Higuain's late strike secures crucial victory
text:
Gonzalo Higuain came off the bench to score the winner as Juventus moved top of Serie A by beating Inter Milan 2-1 in an intense Derby d'Italia clash at San Siro.

Inter head coach Antonio Conte - who kick-started Juve's run of eight straight titles by delivering the first three - came out second best against his former side and his side slipped to second in the table.

Paulo Dybala's opener was cancelled out by a Lautaro Martinez penalty before Higuain's late decider ended Conte's unbeaten start in the league.

Gonzalo Higuain struck a late winner for Juventus to secure a crucial victory at Inter Milan

The Juventus frontman rounded off a superb team move by slotting under Samir Handanovic

MATCH FACTS Inter Milan: Handanovic, Godin (Bastoni 54), de Vrij, Skriniar, D'Ambrosio, Barella, Brozovic, Sensi (Vecino 34), Asamoah, Lukaku, Martinez (Politano 78) Unused substitutes: Gagliardini, Ranocchia, Lazaro, Valero, Dimarco, Padelli, Esposito, Biraghi, Candreva Scorers: Martinez 18 Booked: Vecino, Barella Juventus: Szczesny, Cuadrado, Bonucci, de Ligt, Sandro, Pjanic, Khedira (Bentancur 62), Matuidi, Bernardeschi (Higuain 62), Dybala (Can 71), Ronaldo Unused substitutes: Ramsey, Rugani, Rabiot, Demiral, Pinsoglio, Buffon Scorers: Dybala 4, Higuain 80 Booked: Sandro, Can, Pjanic

It took just four minutes for the visitors to break the deadlock. Miralem Pjanic's long pass found Dybala on the edge of the box and the Argentina international fired home past the out-stretched arms of goalkeeper Samir Handanovic for the opener.

Five minutes later Cristiano Ronaldo came close to doubling his side's lead as his powerful effort from the edge of the 18-yard box struck the crossbar.

Inter pressed for an equaliser but Nicolo Barella fired over the bar following a corner, moments before they were awarded a penalty, confirmed by VAR, after Matthijs De Ligt handled the ball in the area.

Martinez stepped up to take the resulting spot-kick and struck the ball powerfully into the bottom corner, leaving Wojciech Szczesny - who guessed the right way - with no chance after 18 minutes.

Ronaldo fired a free-kick at the Inter wall as Juve attempted to restore their lead midway through the first half, while Romelu Lukaku received medical attention over a knock for the hosts.

Inter came close to taking the lead as the half-hour approached but Szczesny pulled off a great save to deny Martinez at the far post.

Lautaro Martinez had netted Inter Milan's equaliser from the penalty spot against Juventus

The Argentine striker kept his cool from 12 yards to blast the spot kick past Wojciech Szczesny

Paulo Dybala had fired Juventus into the lead on four minutes after a finish from a tight angle

The Juventus striker was marked by Milan Skriniar but held his nerve to rifle home the opener

The home side lost Stefano Sensi to injury after 33 minutes and to make matters worse, it looked like Juve had gone ahead for the second time just before the break before Ronaldo's strike was ruled offside.

The Bianconeri started the second half with intent and Federico Bernardeschi came close with a long-range effort before Ronaldo pelted Alex Sandro's pass well wide of the upright.

Dybala went in search of a second goal and had a great chance when one-on-one with Handanovic, but the Slovenian stopper did enough to deny him after 56 minutes.

The clash between the top sides in Serie A resulted in an end-to-end first half at the San Siro

Cristiano Ronaldo saw a strike ruled out for offside in the first half after linking up with Dybala

Dybala was denied his second goal of the game after a brave stop from keeper Handanovic

Juve were denied a penalty shout on the stroke of half-time and the Nerazzurri had an appeal turned down themselves as Lukaku was brought down by De Ligt midway through the second half.

Inter midfielder Marcelo Brozovic hit a post minutes later and - at the other end - Ronaldo forced Handanovic to save his low angled shot with his legs as both sides pressed.

The visitors took the lead for the second time with 10 minutes remaining as second-half substitute Higuain picked up Ronaldo's pass in the box and made no mistake, firing the ball beyond Handanovic.

The home side surged forward and Brozovic came close to equalising but he was denied by a vital save from Szczesny before Matteo Politano's corner found the goalkeeper's hands as Juve held on.
description: Gonzalo Higuain came off the bench to score the winner as Juventus moved top of Serie A by beating Inter Milan 2-1 in an intense Derby d'Italia clash at San Siro.
